quotes.quote: For the two of us, home isn't a place. It is a person. And we are finally home.

What is home? My favorite definition is "a safe place," a place where one is free from attack, a place where one experiences secure relationships and affirmation. It's a place where people share and understand each other.
The ache for home lives in all of us. The safe place where we can go as we are and not be questioned.
Home isn't where you're from, it's where you find light when all grows dark.
Home is people. Not a place. If you go back there after the people are gone, then all you can see is what is not there any more.
Home's where you go when you run out of homes.
Perhaps home is not a place but simply an irrevocable condition.

Home wasn't a set house, or a single town on a map. It was wherever the people who loved you were, whenever you were together. Not a place, but a moment, and then another, building on each other like bricks to create a solid shelter that you take with you for your entire life, wherever you may go.
Home is the nicest word there is.
A home filled with nothing but yourself. It's heavy, that lightness. It's crushing, that emptiness.
Well, sometimes home is a person.
Home isn't a place, its a feeling.
The home only fulfills its true purpose when it is God controlled.
A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
The most important work you and I will ever do will be within the walls of our own homes.
A good home must be made, not bought.
My home is not a place, it is people.
The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
Home is not where you live but where they understand you.
There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
Peace - that was the other name for home.
Home is any four walls that enclose the right person.
Home is where there's one to love us
A house is not a home unless it contains food and fire for the mind as well as the body.
A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.
A hundred men may make an encampment, but it takes a woman to make a home.
Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
The home is the center and circumference, the start and the finish, of most of our lives.
The most important things in your home are people.
Home is a place you grow up wanting to leave, and grow old wanting to get back to.
Home is a shelter from storms - all sorts of storms.
He is the happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home.
Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.
Home is where you can say anything you please, because nobody pays any attention to you anyway.
Home interprets heaven. Home is heaven for beginners.
Home is one's birthplace, ratified by memory.
The home is the chief school of human virtues.
Run a home like you would a small business and treat it with the same seriousness.
Home sweet home. This is the place to find happiness. If one doesn't find it here, one doesn't find it anywhere.
A home without books is a body without soul.
A house is made with walls and beams. A home is made with love and dreams.
Home - a place where the small are great, and the great are small.
There is no place more delightful than one's own fireside.
Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do, but how much love we put in that action.
Home is the most popular, and will be the most enduring of all earthly establishments.
The worst thing about work in the house or home is that whatever you do is destroyed, laid waste or eaten within twenty four hours.
Home is where the heart is.
If you want a golden rule that will fit everything, this is it: Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful.
The house a woman creates is a Utopia. She can't help it -- can't help trying to interest her nearest and dearest not in happiness itself but in the search for it.
Bricks and mortar make a house, but the laughter of children makes a home.
Mid pleasures and palaces though we may roam, Be it ever so humble, there's no place like home.
I think that when you invite people to your home, you invite them to yourself.
One can say of language that it is potentially the only human home, the only dwelling place that cannot be hostile to man.
Home wasn't built in a day.
Be grateful for the home you have, knowing that at this moment, all you have is all you need.
A man's home is his wife's castle.
The home should be the treasure chest of living.
The home is not the one tame place in the world of adventure. It is the one wild place in the world of rules and set tasks.
Home -- that blessed word, which opens to the human heart the most perfect glimpse of Heaven, and helps to carry it thither, as on an angel's wings.
We shape our dwellings, and afterwards our dwellings shape us.
When I go home, its an easy way to be grounded. You learn to realize what truly matters.
People who have good relationships at home are more effective in the marketplace.

When we are young and restless to be free, home is the place from which we long to escape. But if there is still a home intact when trouble arises and life becomes a battlefield, home is the place to which we yearn to return.
The world is not a permanent home, it is only a temporary dwelling.
Our lives speak loudly to those around us, especially the children in our home.
Home was a refuge for me, a place I could truly relax.
My home is in heaven. I'm just passing through this world.
There's no place like home - after the other places close.
Thoughts of home and all its loved ones to the soldier's heart would come.
Home, home, sweet, sweet home! There's no place like home, oh, there's no place like home!
There was nothing as pricelessly humanitarian; as home; sweet home.
Home along, home along, to the place where I would be!
Let the others rant an' roam. When they git away from home.
To light the poorest home; hearts warmer grow.
Nobody's home to offer a cup of coffee, nobody's home to say goodbye.
A home that was envisioned to withstand the storms of the world is found flooded from within.
Now, returned home after so many thousands of miles of road and ocean, all the hulls sailed in,
